name: Emgage Foundation
mission: Emgage is a national, non-partisan organization that informs and mobilizes Muslim American voters in support of policies that enable our communities to ...
theoryOfChange: Emgage Foundation utilizes a strategic framework evident in its published 'Impact Report' and 'Annual Reports'. These documents detail their data-driven approach to voter mobilization and civic engagement, outlining how their activities lead to intended impact. For instance, the 2020 Impact Report for the Million Muslim Votes campaign explicitly shares the strategies used and the resulting impact, including voter turnout numbers and organizing efforts. Emgage's approach involves targeted canvassing, personalized texting, phone banking, and strategic ad campaigns to educate and motivate voters, as well as programs like the Emerging Leaders Program to train future leaders. They emphasize a data-driven methodology to identify areas where engagement can yield effective impact and are dedicated to bridging the gap between the electorate and policies that affect their lives through grassroots efforts.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="4">93.3% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring all revenue supports its mission-driven activities.
Emgage demonstrates robust liquidity with <cite id="8">15.3 months of working capital</cite> available to sustain operations.
The foundation spends only <cite id="9">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, far exceeding industry benchmarks.

strengths_deep_dive: Emgage Foundation has demonstrated remarkable growth, achieving a <cite id="10">3-year revenue CAGR of 65.6%</cite>, which indicates a rapidly expanding donor base and operational footprint. This growth is supported by a <cite id="11">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>, the highest level of recognition for non-profit disclosure. Their impact is quantified through high-volume outreach, such as <cite id="12">924 civic trainings</cite> and thousands of GOTV phone calls reported in their developmental years. Furthermore, the organization acts as a significant grantmaker, distributing <cite id="13">$630,000 in domestic grants</cite> to 14 recipients, including groups like <cite id="14">OCA-Greater Houston and Every Voice TX</cite>, to strengthen the broader civic ecosystem.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2017, Emgage Foundation is a national non-profit dedicated to <cite id="1">empowering Muslim Americans through civic engagement</cite>, voter mobilization, and leadership development. The organization operates as a non-partisan entity that <cite id="2">informs and mobilizes Muslim American voters</cite> in support of policies that enable their communities to thrive. In 2023, the foundation reported a <cite id="3">total revenue of $4,918,661</cite>, representing a significant scale-up in its operational capacity. A hallmark of the organization is its financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 93.3%</cite> according to its most recent tax filings, ensuring that resources are directed toward core civic initiatives. Their work is centered on data-driven advocacy, including the <cite id="5">Million Muslim Votes Campaign</cite> and the Emerging Leaders Program, which seeks to build a pipeline of civically active youth. By focusing on <cite id="6">systemic change and voter turnout</cite>, Emgage addresses the long-term political representation of Muslim communities in the United States, particularly in key states like <cite id="7">Florida, Michigan, and Virginia</cite>.
